content:
ToolStripDropDown.ToolStripDropDownAccessibleObject Class

Definition

Provides information about the ToolStripDropDown control to accessibility client applications.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public class ToolStripDropDown.ToolStripDropDownAccessibleObject : System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.ToolStripAccessibleObject
Inheritance
System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip+ToolStripAccessibleObject
ToolStripDropDown.ToolStripDropDownAccessibleObject

Remarks

Windows Forms has accessibility support built in and provides information about your application that allows it to work with accessibility client applications. Examples of accessibility client applications are screen enlarger and reviewer utilities, voice input utilities, on-screen keyboards, alternative input devices, and keyboard enhancement utilities.

Constructors

ToolStripDropDown.ToolStripDropDownAccessibleObject(ToolStripDropDown)

Initializes a new instance of the ToolStripDropDown.ToolStripDropDownAccessibleObject class.

public ToolStripDropDownAccessibleObject (System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown owner);
owner
ToolStripDropDown

The ToolStripDropDown that owns the ToolStripDropDown.ToolStripDropDownAccessibleObject.

Properties

Name

Gets or sets the name of the ToolStripDropDown.ToolStripDropDownAccessibleObject.

public override string Name { get; set; }
Value
String

The string representing the name.

Role

Gets the role of the ToolStripDropDown.ToolStripDropDownAccessibleObject.

public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Role { get; }
Value
AccessibleRole

The AccessibleRole value.
